description: Provides information about the specified custom language model. This operation also shows if the base language model that you used to create your custom language model has been updated. If Amazon Transcribe has updated the base model, you can create a new custom language model using the updated base model. If you tried to create a new custom language model and the request wasn't successful, you can use DescribeLanguageModel to help identify the reason for this failure.

parameters.name: ModelName
parameters.description: The name of the custom language model you want information about. Model names are case sensitive.

nested_items.name: LanguageModel
nested_items.description: Provides information about the specified custom language model.

nested_items.name: ModelName
nested_items.description: A unique name, chosen by you, for your custom language model.

nested_items.name: CreateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time the specified custom language model was created.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedTime
nested_items.description: The date and time the specified custom language model was last modified.

nested_items.name: LanguageCode
nested_items.description: The language code used to create your custom language model. Each custom language model must contain terms in only one language, and the language you select for your custom language model must match the language of your training and tuning data.

nested_items.name: BaseModelName
nested_items.description: The Amazon Transcribe standard language model, or base model, used to create your custom language model.

nested_items.name: ModelStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the specified custom language model. When the status displays as COMPLETED the model is ready for use.

nested_items.name: UpgradeAvailability
nested_items.description: Shows if a more current base model is available for use with the specified custom language model.

nested_items.name: FailureReason
nested_items.description: If ModelStatus is FAILED, FailureReason contains information about why the custom language model request failed. See also: Common Errors.

nested_items.name: InputDataConfig
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location of the input files used to train and tune your custom language model, in addition to the data access role ARN (Amazon Resource Name) that has permissions to access these data.

nested_items.name: S3Uri
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location (URI) of the text files you want to use to train your custom language model.

nested_items.name: TuningDataS3Uri
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location (URI) of the text files you want to use to tune your custom language model.

nested_items.name: DataAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that has permissions to access the Amazon S3 bucket that contains your input files. If the role that you specify doesn't have the appropriate permissions to access the specified Amazon S3 location, your request fails.
